text: what is the difference between a `userId` and a `hubId` from the *`/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}` endpoint (reference:* <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth/tokens>)

Hi all,
I am trying to connect Google sheets to my HubSpot app in order to import historic emails. I have set up the app and everything seems to be working. However, somehow my template is pasted twice when sending the activity to HubSpot. I have tried everything to find the problem but so far no luck (as well as when approaching the HubSpot & Make support desk.
Anyone here who has experience with using the timeline events and can help me out?
Many thanks!

If you are only using apis and do not need Authentication, Go with private apps
1. Public apps are required when your app is working in multiple portal. In that case, Every portal must provide access to the public app. 
2. Private apps are private and can only access the portal in which it is created.

Not sure If that will work but can you have a look at this
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Timeline-Templates-Formatting/m-p/271808>
I believe, it’s putting the content both in header template and details template. Do you have anything under data tab?

Hello Everyone - I had a question and was directed to the developer forum (so I hope I am in the right place - if not please redirect me).  My question was in regards to an API authorization token?  I have a vendor that will be dropping sales contact data (so I dont have to manually enter the data and improve my sales efficiency) - I thought it was as simple as providing them my API however they mentioned an authorization token that I would need to provide, but I dont know where to find it.  I had another vendor that did the same thing and all they needed was my API key.  We ran a test contact and boom it came through simple as that.  Initially I am thinking that this shouldn't be overly complicated but am I missing something?  Is there a place I should be looking to get that code or are they getting something lost in translation.  I am a one man shop.
thanks in advance for your assistance.

Thanks -- this was a good idea and worth a try, but doesn't seem to work on tasks.  Looking at what the UI does, it seems to edit the task and store it in a completely separate field and then return "bodyPreviewHtml" but I can't find a hack to do it through the API. For now I guess I just need to figure out a good wording and just let the text flow.

But the community site was a good source and this might work -- I'll update for later searchers if I make it work: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Injecting-HTML-into-a-Engagement-Task-though-the-API/m-p/406021#M40214>
As far as I understand, You have a vendor that will be sending data into HubSpot. If that is the case, you can simply use Api key or private apps.
<@U02U398CDFG> Thanks indirectly as the community site search example works like a charm!  Very undocumented so a bit scary but got me going for now.
Ooo thanks <@U02U398CDFG>! I didn’t see “is known” – think that’ll update on any other properties changed?
thank you - I am not familiar with private apps, but I am with the API key which I can simply get from my settings.

Hello Everyone - I want to import files in HubSpot so I got a article about import api but it in python .I am trying to do the same in .net with httpclient but its not calling that import api . Anyone here who has experience with this api call in .net .Please help me out with this
